item.title: Robert add a quote by Paavo Haavikko
item.description: "Finnish is not a language, it is a way of setting at the end of the bench with your fur cap pulled over your ears." -- Paavo Haavikko

item.title: Robert add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Robert add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Robert add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Robert add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Robert add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Robert add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I just can't listen to any more Wagner, you know...I'm starting to get the urge to conquer Poland." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Robert add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Robert add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Robert add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Robert add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "She's the sort of woman who lives for others - you can tell the others by their hunted expression." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Robert add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Robert add a quote by Clint Eastwood
item.description: "Tomorrow is promised to no one." -- Clint Eastwood

item.title: Robert add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Too bad that all the people who know how to run the country are busy driving taxicabs and cutting hair." -- George Burns

item.title: Robert add a quote by Andrew Jackson
item.description: "It is a damn poor mind that can think of only one way to spell a word." -- Andrew Jackson

item.title: Robert add a quote by steve martin
item.description: "I believe that sex is one of the most beautiful, natural, wholesome things that money can buy." -- steve martin

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mika Waltari
item.description:
"And what will be their fate?” he asked. “Forgive me master, but I am curious to know, so that my heart may prepare itself.”
“Flesh without spirit,” I said. “Life without hope, the slavery of mankind-a bondage so hopeless that slaves will no longer know they are slaves. Wealth without happiness, abundance without the power to enjoy it. The death of the spirit." -- Mika Waltari

item.title: Robert add a quote by Luther Burbank
item.description: "It is well for people who think, to change their minds ocasionally in order to keep them clean. " -- Luther Burbank

item.title: Robert add a quote by Richard Wagner
item.description: "I believe in God, Mozart and Beethoven, and likewise their disciples and apostles; - I believe in the Holy Spirit and the truth of the one, indivisible Art; - I believe that this Art proceeds from God, and lives within the hearts of all illumined men; - I believe that he who once has bathed in the sublime delights of this high Art, is consecrate to Her for ever, and never can deny Her; - I believe that through Art all men are saved." -- Richard Wagner

item.title: Robert add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: ". . .and the thing that you know to be true is the lie that will kill you." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Robert add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not walk backward in life." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Robert add a quote by Stephen R. Donaldson
item.description: "Any belief that puts itself beyond doubt nurtures its own collapse." -- Stephen R. Donaldson

item.title: Robert add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I want God to play in my bloodstream the way sunlight amuses itself on the water." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Robert add a quote by Candace Bushnell
item.description: "I make mistakes. That's what I do. I speak without thinking, I act without knowing. I drink so much that I can barely walk...I'm a fantastic lover though, and an amazing friend. God knows I mean well." -- Candace Bushnell
